Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by New York (A) in 1967...
Injured on 8/6/1975 with a Fractured Wrist, out for 4 weeks...
Had first career hit on 6/17/1978, off Dave Pagan (CAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/25/1978, off Rich Hand (MIN)...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Won World Series with New York (A) in 1980...
Hit for the cycle against Baltimore on 5/3/1983...
Drove in 6 runs against Baltimore on 5/3/1983...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 8/15/1984 to a 1-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (A) on 5/5/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $324,000 per year...
Drafted in 1st round, 6th overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1987...
Drafted in 1st round, 6th overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1987...
Injured on 8/25/1987 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for one week...
Earned first career win on 7/23/1988...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/5/1994 to a 3-year deal worth $4,500,000 per year...
Injured on 9/23/1995 with a Pulled Bicep Tendon, out for 3-4 weeks...
Traded from Minnesota to Pittsburgh on 4/18/1996 (Going to PIT: P J. McDowell, P J. Robinson. Going to MIN: P R. Seanez)...
Won World Series with Pittsburgh in 1996...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 2/10/1997 to a 3-year deal worth $3,320,000 per year...
Injured on 5/29/1997 with a Jammed Finger, out for 1-2 weeks...
